between these is um regression is when you're trying to predict a value on a
Continuum so a number right uh that's a continuous value so the example of
wanting to predict um the cost of a home for example is is regression um classification on the
other hand is when you're trying to predict one of several discrete buckets
okay okay so um is the um is this person going to return to the hospital within
the next 90 days yes or no um is uh who's going to win the big game you know
this team or that team um it doesn't have to be binary either I'm giving binary examples here but like um what

anomaly detection is a very specialized case that you can use when you have a
highly unbalanced data set so think for example um of the problem of credit card
fraud detection right so if you have a credit card transaction database then
hopefully um the majority of that data is all you know valid transactions and
then the number of uh data points in your um thing your you know your fraudulent transactions are hopefully a
pretty small subset of the entire database and then the number of known
fraudulent transactions is going to be even smaller still so if I have like a really small amount of known fraudulent
transactions and a ton of valid transactions it's really hard to feed you know a ton of data over here versus
only a little over here um into a conventional algorithm and have it perform really well and so anomaly
detection is a really great way to take um essentially kind of train on the the good good data establish what normal
looks like and then um be able to distinguish things that are outside of normal so that's anomaly detection okay
